Posts.Content: Hi Worried2016 Yes it could get a bit hectic on xmas morning at 4am and the triplets wanting to open presents, but worth it.  A lot different now though, in fact a lot less expensive, now I just buy them a easter egg and tell them they have over slept. ha ha. Regards Mally
Posts.Title: Lost it with the kids

Posts.Content: Hi LondonLass This is true I called into my place of work yesterday and a work colleague asked if I had started my Chemo sessions yet, I replied that I had. You are looking really well on it, she replied.  I'm almost looking forward to my next session now, ha ha Mally
Posts.Title: WHY WOULD YOU SAY THAT....

Posts.Content: Hi I do have to admit I find myself having a bit of a chuckle reading these posts. I'm experiencing word for word the exact same. My wife and I separated 18 months ago, before I was diagnosed with cancer, I choose to have my three 18 year old kids (2 boys and a girl triplets) live with me. Even though they can be a pain in the ass ( most of the time) not one day goes by when I think how things would have been if I had let the mother stay with them instead of me, just having them here and them doing ball all, means the world to me and, I can say with all honesty I would be in a very dark place without them. I do turn the internet off now and again when they over step the mark.ha ha. Regards Mally
Posts.Title: Lost it with the kids
